block.p: The Coping column ''Invisible? Sadly Just the Opposite'' (Oct. 8) refers to a black advertising executive who one day was folding clothes in the laundry room of her building because her housekeeper was away and was asked by a neighbor if she has an extra day to do her laundry.
Questions have been raised as to whether I was the person described here.

The Coping column ''Invisible? Sadly Just the Opposite'' (Oct. 8) refers to a black advertising executive who one day was folding clothes in the laundry room of her building because her housekeeper was away and was asked by a neighbor if she has an extra day to do her laundry.
Questions have been raised as to whether I was the person described here.

In all fairness to my neighbors, many whom are dear friends, not one has ever asked if I had any extra hours to do their laundry. If they had, you would have known. I am a freelance writer and this surely would have made good copy.
